legal_citation: Delaware Code Title 29, Chapter 100, Sections 10001 through 10008

response_deadline_days.extension_available: Additional 10 business days for voluminous requests
response_deadline_days.deemed_denied: If no response within required timeframe

law_summary.appeal_process: Attorney General petition (30 days), then court suit (60 days)
law_summary.appeal_deadline: 60 days from denial or learning of action
law_summary.attorney_general_role: Issues determinations but no injunctive power
law_summary.criminal_penalties: Misdemeanor - up to $500 fine and/or 30 days jail
law_summary.attorney_fees: Available if court finds willful violation
law_summary.web_portal_required: All agencies must have web portals using AG standard forms
key_exemptions: Trade secrets and confidential commercial information
Information exempted by statute or common law

request_templates.name: Delaware Standard FOIA Request
request_templates.description: General purpose records request for Delaware state agencies using web portal
request_templates.template_text:
Dear Records Custodian:

Pursuant to the Delaware Freedom of Information Act, 29 Del. C. §§ 10001 through 10008, I respectfully request access to and copies of the following public records:

[DESCRIBE RECORDS WITH SUFFICIENT DETAIL TO ENABLE AGENCY TO LOCATE THEM]

As a Delaware citizen, I am entitled to examine and obtain copies of public records per 29 Del. C. § 10003(a). This request is being submitted through your agency's web portal using the Attorney General's standard request form as required by 29 Del. C. § 10003(c).

Per 29 Del. C. § 10003(d), please respond within 15 business days by either:
1. Providing access to the requested records;
2. Denying access with specific statutory justification per § 10004; or
3. Advising that additional time is needed per § 10003(e).

If you need additional time due to voluminous material or legal review requirements, you may extend the response period for up to 10 additional business days by providing written notice within the initial 15-day period.

Regarding fees per 29 Del. C. § 10005:
- I understand the first 20 pages will be provided free of charge
- Standard copies over 20 pages: $0.10 per sheet ($0.20 double-sided)
- Microfilm/microfiche over 20 pages: $0.15 per sheet
- Electronic format: Actual cost of electronic media

If you determine portions of these records are exempt under 29 Del. C. § 10004, please provide the non-exempt portions and cite the specific exemption for any withholdings.

If you deny this request, please be advised that I may petition the Attorney General for a determination per 29 Del. C. § 10006(c) or file suit within 60 days per 29 Del. C. § 10006(b).

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

Sincerely,
[REQUESTER NAME]
[DELAWARE ADDRESS - CITIZENSHIP REQUIRED]
[CITY, STATE ZIP]
[PHONE NUMBER]
[EMAIL ADDRESS]
[DATE]

request_templates.name: Delaware Attorney General FOIA Petition
request_templates.description: Template for petitioning Attorney General for FOIA violation determination
request_templates.template_text:
Dear Attorney General:

Pursuant to 29 Del. C. § 10006(c), I respectfully petition your office for a determination of whether [AGENCY NAME] has violated or is about to violate the Delaware Freedom of Information Act.

**BACKGROUND:**
On [REQUEST DATE], I submitted a FOIA request to [AGENCY NAME] seeking the following public records:
[DESCRIBE ORIGINAL REQUEST]

**ALLEGED VIOLATION:**
[Choose applicable:]
☐ Agency failed to respond within 15 business days (or extended 25 days)
☐ Agency improperly denied access to public records
☐ Agency failed to provide statutorily required web portal
☐ Agency charged excessive fees beyond statutory limits
☐ Other violation: [DESCRIBE]

**SPECIFIC FACTS:**
[DESCRIBE TIMELINE AND AGENCY ACTIONS]

**LEGAL GROUNDS:**
The agency's actions violate Delaware FOIA because:
1. [EXPLAIN VIOLATION OF SPECIFIC STATUTORY PROVISION]
2. [CITE RELEVANT EXEMPTIONS THAT DON'T APPLY]
3. [REFERENCE DELAWARE'S POLICY OF LIBERAL CONSTRUCTION PER § 10001]

**SUPPORTING DOCUMENTATION:**
☐ Copy of original FOIA request
☐ Copy of agency response/denial (if any)
☐ Correspondence with agency
☐ Other: [DESCRIBE]

**REQUEST FOR DETERMINATION:**
I respectfully request that you determine whether [AGENCY NAME] has violated 29 Del. C. Chapter 100 and issue a written determination within 30 days as required by § 10006(c).

I understand that your determination is limited to whether a violation has occurred and that you do not have authority to issue injunctions or assess penalties under this provision.

I prefer to resolve this matter through your determination process before considering judicial action under § 10006(a) or (b).

Thank you for your attention to this matter.

Sincerely,
[REQUESTER NAME]
[DELAWARE ADDRESS]
[CITY, STATE ZIP]
[PHONE NUMBER]
[EMAIL ADDRESS]
[DATE]

Enclosures: [LIST SUPPORTING DOCUMENTS]

request_templates.name: Delaware Superior Court FOIA Action
request_templates.description: Template for filing court action to compel disclosure or challenge agency action
request_templates.template_text:
IN THE SUPERIOR COURT OF DELAWARE
IN AND FOR [COUNTY] COUNTY

[PLAINTIFF NAME],           )
  Plaintiff,               )
                          )
  v.                      )  C.A. No. ____________
                          )
[DEFENDANT AGENCY/OFFICIAL], )
  Defendant.              )

COMPLAINT FOR VIOLATION OF DELAWARE FREEDOM OF INFORMATION ACT

TO THE HONORABLE COURT:

Plaintiff brings this action under 29 Del. C. § 10006 to compel disclosure of public records and/or challenge actions taken in violation of the Delaware Freedom of Information Act.

1. JURISDICTION AND VENUE
This Court has jurisdiction under 29 Del. C. § 10006. This action is brought within 60 days of [DENIAL DATE/LEARNING OF ACTION] as required by statute.

2. PARTIES
Plaintiff is a Delaware citizen entitled to access public records under Delaware FOIA.

Defendant is a public body subject to the Delaware FOIA.

3. FACTUAL BACKGROUND
[DESCRIBE REQUEST, AGENCY RESPONSE, AND VIOLATION]

4. VIOLATION OF DELAWARE FOIA
Defendant violated Delaware FOIA by:
a) [SPECIFIC STATUTORY VIOLATION]
b) [IMPROPER APPLICATION OF EXEMPTION]
c) [OTHER VIOLATIONS]

5. COUNTS
COUNT I: Violation of 29 Del. C. § 10003 [Access to Public Records]
COUNT II: [ADDITIONAL COUNTS AS APPLICABLE]

6. REQUEST FOR RELIEF
WHEREFORE, Plaintiff respectfully requests:
a) Order compelling disclosure of requested public records;
b) Declaration that Defendant violated Delaware FOIA;
c) Assessment of reasonable attorney's fees and costs per 29 Del. C. § 10006(d) for willful violation;
d) Such other relief as the Court deems just and proper.

**DEMAND FOR JURY TRIAL**
Plaintiff demands trial by jury on all issues so triable.

Respectfully submitted,

_________________________
[ATTORNEY NAME AND BAR NUMBER]
[OR PLAINTIFF SIGNATURE IF PRO SE]
[ADDRESS]
[CITY, STATE ZIP]
[PHONE NUMBER]
[EMAIL ADDRESS]
Attorney for Plaintiff [OR "Pro Se"]

VERIFICATION
[Include verification that complaint facts are true and correct]
